text.__SUMMARY__: The  San Salvador blind snake (Epictia columbi) is a species of snake in the family Leptotyphlopidae.
text.Etymology: The specific name, columbi, is in honor of Christopher Columbus.
text.Geographic range: It is endemic to San Salvador Island in The Bahamas.
text.Further reading: Klauber LM (1939). "Three New Worm Snakes of the Genus Leptotyphlops". Trans. San Diego Soc. Nat. Hist. 9 (14): 59-65. (Leptotyphlops columbi, new species, pp. 62–64 + Figures 3a & 3b on p. 65).
